title: New York's 60th State Senate district
text:
<a href="New%20York%20%28state%29">New York</a>'s 60th State Senate district is one of 63 districts in the <a href="New%20York%20State%20Senate">New York State Senate</a>. It has been represented by <a href="Democratic%20Party%20%28United%20States%29">Democrat</a> <a href="Sean%20Ryan%20%28American%20politician%29">Sean Ryan</a> since 2021, succeeding <a href="Republican%20Party%20%28United%20States%29">Republican</a> <a href="Chris%20Jacobs%20%28politician%29">Chris Jacobs</a>, who was <a href="2020%20New%20York%27s%2027th%20congressional%20district%20special%20election">elected to Congress</a>.
Geography.
District 60 is located entirely within <a href="Erie%20County%2C%20New%20York">Erie County</a> in <a href="Western%20New%20York">Western New York</a>, including much of southern <a href="Buffalo%2C%20New%20York">Buffalo</a> and the surrounding suburbs of <a href="Brant%2C%20New%20York">Brant</a>, <a href="Evans%2C%20New%20York">Evans</a>, <a href="Grand%20Island%2C%20New%20York">Grand Island</a>, <a href="Hamburg%2C%20New%20York">Hamburg</a>, <a href="Orchard%20Park%20%28town%29%2C%20New%20York">Orchard Park</a>, and the <a href="Tonawanda%20%28city%29%2C%20New%20York">city</a> and <a href="Tonawanda%20%28town%29%2C%20New%20York">town of Tonawanda</a>.
The district overlaps with New York's <a href="New%20York%27s%2026th%20congressional%20district">26th</a> and <a href="New%20York%27s%2027th%20congressional%20district">27th congressional districts</a>, and with the 140th, 141st, 142nd, 145th, 147th, and 149th districts of the <a href="New%20York%20State%20Assembly">New York State Assembly</a>.
